name: The Haunting of Hill House
author: Shirley Jackson
description: A chilling tale of a group of people, each with their own troubled pasts, who come to spend the summer in a notoriously haunted mansion.

name: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: The classic vampire novel that introduced the iconic Count Dracula and his reign of terror.

name: Pet Sematary
author: Stephen King
description: A disturbing story about a family who discovers a mysterious burial ground with the power to bring the dead back to life.

name: The Call of the Wild
author: Jack London
description: The thrilling story of Buck, a domesticated dog who is stolen and thrust into the harsh wilderness of the Klondike Gold Rush.

name: Into the Wild
author: Jon Krakauer
description: The true story of Christopher McCandless, who gave up his comfortable life to venture alone into the Alaskan wilderness.

name: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut is stranded on Mars after his team leaves him for dead, and he must use his ingenuity to survive.

name: Eloquent JavaScript: A Modern Introduction to Programming
author: Marijn Haverbeke
description: A comprehensive and well-regarded book that introduces JavaScript and fundamental programming concepts.

name: HTML and CSS: Design and Build Websites
author: Jon Duckett
description: A visual and practical guide to learning HTML and CSS for building websites.

name: You Don't Know JS Yet: Get Started
author: Kyle Simpson
description: The first book in a popular series that dives deep into the core mechanisms of JavaScript.

name: Atomic Habits: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones
author: James Clear
description: A practical guide to forming good habits, breaking bad ones, and making small changes that deliver remarkable results.

name: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A sweeping and thought-provoking exploration of the history of our species, from the Stone Age to the present.

name: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: A groundbreaking exploration of the two systems that drive the way we think.
